citations.narrative:
The facility has some areas in disrepair.
-- The shift door guide within indoor holding of the snow leopard enclosure has severe rust and flaking along with a
disintegrating section of metal on the lower left side, leaving sharp edges.
-- The shift door in the red panda exhibit has areas of flaking paint peeling off. The door is located inside the primary
enclosure and can be accessed by the animal.
-- Along the perimeter of the lynx enclosure, the vertical steel support beams on the inside have areas of flaking paint that
are peeling off the underlying metal structure.
-- Two sheets of foam insulation board resting on top of the indoor raccoon enclosure are broken with multiple small
pieces of foam resting on top of the metal mesh.
Facilities that are in disrepair with flaking paint, excessive rust creating sharp metal edges, or damaged facilities can pose
an ingestion hazard to the animals as well as cause potential injury or other illnesses.
Correct by ensuring all housing facilities are structurally sound and maintained in good repair to protect the animals from
injury and to contain the animals.
.

The building holding dry food storage has an accumulation of clutter that prevents full visualization of the floor, around
food storage, and the peripheral edges of the room. It is important that all areas within food storage can be routinely
monitored and inspected for signs of pests or other potential contaminates of food. Correct by April 6, 2023 by ensuring all
premises (buildings and grounds) are kept clean and in good repair.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) or by May 22, 2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
